title: Vaccine Skepticism Spreads to Pets; Generics for ADHD Approved; Malaria in Maryland
author: Michael DePeau-Wilson
description: Health news and commentary from around the Web gathered by MedPage Today staff
cleaned_text: Note that some links may require registration or subscription. Some [dog owners questioned pet vaccines](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0264410X23010150) like rabies, survey data showed. (Vaccine) The FDA approved multiple [generics of lisdexamfetamine dimesylate to treat attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder](https://www.fda.gov/drugs/news-events-human-drugs/fda-approves-multiple-generics-adhd-and-bed-treatment) (ADHD) in children 6 years and older and adults, as well as binge-eating disorder in adults. The Biden administration announced the first 10 drugs up for [Medicare price negotiations](https://www.medpagetoday.com/washington-watch/washington-watch/106102). Some individuals said semaglutide (Ozempic,Wegovy) [curbed their craving for alcohol.](https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2023/08/28/1194526119/ozempic-wegovy-drinking-alcohol-cravings-semaglutide) (NPR) In northern Mexico, an epidemic of Rocky Mountain spotted fever, a tick-borne disease, [led to more than 2,000 cases](https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/interactive/2023/tick-diseases-rocky-mountain-spotted-fever/?itid=sf_health_article_list) and hundreds of deaths in recent years. (Washington Post) China will drop its [requirement for a negative COVID-19 test](https://thehill.com/policy/international/4174515-china-drops-covid-testing-for-international-arrivals/) from international travelers starting Wednesday. (The Hill) A case of locally-acquired malaria in Maryland [involved a different species](https://emergency.cdc.gov/han/2023/pdf/CDC_HAN_496.pdf) from previous cases in Florida and Texas, the CDC said. Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer (D) will call on state lawmakers [to pass legislation aimed at protecting key elements of the Affordable Care Act](https://apnews.com/article/whitmer-affordable-care-act-codify-preventive-978f6172dc247be001bb2702c8653bd3). (Associated Press) Pfizer announced plans to [restart manufacturing later this year](https://www.fiercepharma.com/pharma/pfizer-telegraphs-fourth-quarter-production-restart-rocky-mount-plant-damaged-tornado) at the North Carolina factory damaged by a tornado in July. (Fierce Pharma) Astronauts on NASA's SpaceX Crew-7 mission began conducting biomedical research on the International Space Station as part of [a 6-month-long, 200-experiment](https://www.fiercebiotech.com/research/new-crew-new-experiments-nasas-spacex-crew-7-mission-brings-more-biomedical-research-iss) medical research effort. (Fierce Biotech) Europe will continue to have a [shortage of diabetes drugs](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/eli-lillys-diabetes-drug-remain-shortage-eu-through-september-2023-08-28/) through September, the European Medicines Agency said. (Reuters) A [whole genome test](https://apnews.com/article/genetic-testing-babies-newborns-whole-genome-cc27689e7f9deb88c9b0753d9cd0ba4b) saved the life of a child; could widespread use could help millions more? (AP) [Elton John returned home](https://people.com/elton-john-back-home-following-hospitalization-after-fall-7853387?hid=90ec2c05ca319f937d6719dc59d3c817ed386baa&did=10103449-20230828&utm_campaign=ppl-breakingnews_relationship-builder&utm_source=ppl&utm_medium=email&utm_content=082823&lctg=90ec2c05ca319f937d6719dc59d3c817ed386baa) Monday after a brief hospital stay following a fall. (People) The FDA [expanded the indication for luspatercept](https://news.bms.com/news/details/2023/U.S.-FDA-Approves-Bristol-Myers-Squibbs-Reblozyl-luspatercept-aamt-as-First-Line-Treatment-of-Anemia-in-Adults-with-Lower-Risk-Myelodysplastic-Syndromes-MDS-Who-May-Require-Transfusions/default.aspx) (Reblozyl) to treat anemia in adults with low- to intermediate-risk myelodysplastic syndromes who might require regular blood transfusions, Bristol Myers Squibb said. Samuel "Joe" Wurzelbacher, [known as "Joe the Plumber"](https://thehill.com/homenews/4175177-joe-the-plumber-made-famous-during-obamas-2008-campaign-dead-at-49/) during the 2008 presidential campaign, died Sunday at age 49 from pancreatic cancer. (The Hill)
